Help:Node.title: alteration commands
Help:Node.Log:Description:
COMMAND USAGE: $(keyword)
{? equal | $(theatre:id) | IC | EXAMPLE: alter hose "fit tight"
One of a large set of commands which allow you to alter clothing and other standard items in order to create personalized verbs. The complete list of verbs is $(udat.chatchar)ADORN, for jeweling; $(udat.chatchar)ALTER, for gloving and hatting; $(udat.chatchar)BIND, for bookbinding; $(udat.chatchar)COBBLE, for cobbling; $(udat.chatchar)DYE, for dying; $(udat.chatchar)EMBOSS, for embossing; $(udat.chatchar)EMBROIDER, for embroidering; $(udat.chatchar)ENGRAVE, for engraving; $(udat.chatchar)FORGE, for weaponsmithing; and $(udat.chatchar)TAILOR, for tailoring.
If you type $(udat.chatchar)ALTER [OBJECT], or use any other verb that you prefer, you will be able to see what you can alter on a particular item. To make a change, type $(udat.chatchar)ALTER [OBJECT] "[TRAIT] [VALUE]"
SEE TOPIC: Alteration
